sentences: Ega nooremast pojastki paremat nahka tule kui vanemast.
Peeti ikka imelapseks, aga suurt nahka tast siiski ei tulnud.
Kes teab, kas me plaanist nahka saabki.
context: Õiget is an Estonian adverb or adjective form that means 'well', 'properly', 'acceptably', or 'decently'. It's often used in constructions like 'õiget nahka' which literally translates to 'good skin' but means getting a proper, acceptable outcome from someone. In the example sentences, it appears as part of phrases describing whether someone will give/produce good results, proper behavior, or meet expectations.
